div.l: For all her arte yite hit I hem lete hem go her weye
Lo where they gone lette the children̄ pleye
They gete hym nought lightly be my crown̄
This Cely clerkes ronnen vp and doun̄
With kepe kepe stonde stonde arere war͗e arere
Go wightely thou and I shall kepe hym here
But shortly till it was nyght
They couth nought with all her myght
Her capull cacche it rane a way so faste
Till in a diche they caught hym at the laste
Werye and wete as bestes in the reyne
Came Cely Iohn and with hym come Aleyn
Allas qduod Iohn that day that I was borne
Nowe are we dryve to hethyng and to scorne
Oure corne is stole men wil vs foles calle
Bothe the wardene and oure felawes all
And namely the myln̉er a wele a way
Thus pleyneth Iohn as he gothe by the way
Towarde the mylle and bayarde in his hande
The mylnere sittyng by the fire he fande
For it was nyght and firther myght they nought
But for the loue of god they hym besought
Of herburghe and of ese as her peny
The myln̉er seide if there be any
Swich as it is yite shull ye haue yoᵘur parte
Myn house is streyte but ye haue lyrned arte
Ye can by argument make a place
A myle brode and twenty fote of space
Lete se nowe if this place may suffice
Or make ye it romere with speche as is yoᵘur gise
Nowe Symkyn seide Iohn be seynt Cutberte
Ay arte thou mery and that is faire an swerde
I haue herde say men shulde take of twoo thinges
Silke as he fyndeth or take silke as he bryngeth
But specially I pray the oste full dere
Gete vs mete and drynke and make vs chere
And we wil pay truly at the fulle
With Emty hande men may not hawkes tolle
Lo here oure Siluere redy forto spende
This myln̉er into the town his doughter sende
For ale and brede and rosted hem a gos
And bonde her hors they shulde no more go loos
And in his owne chamber made hem a bedde
